recipe.title: Spiced Up, Oven-Fried Chicken
ingredients: 4 cups crushed plain cornflakes (from 8 cups whole cornflakes)
3 chickens (3 to 3 1/2 pounds each), cut into 8 pieces each
2 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with aluminum foil or spray with nonstick cooking spray. 2. Combine the crushed cornflakes in a large bowl with the smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. 3. Lightly beat eggs with the milk in a bowl. 4. Dip the chicken into the egg mixture, shaking off excess, and then into the crumbs, coating well. Place on the baking sheets, leaving space between the pieces. 5. Bake, in batches, for 1 hour or until golden brown and cooked through. 6. To serve, arrange the chicken on a large platter and sprinkle with parsley.
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with aluminum foil or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
2. Combine the crushed cornflakes in a large bowl with the smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
3. Lightly beat eggs with the milk in a bowl.
4. Dip the chicken into the egg mixture, shaking off excess, and then into the crumbs, coating well. Place on the baking sheets, leaving space between the pieces.
5. Bake, in batches, for 1 hour or until golden brown and cooked through.
6. To serve, arrange the chicken on a large platter and sprinkle with parsley.
